reviewText: My gawd!I ordered this as soon as I saw it. I've probably wasted money trying to be SLICK,because I was buying "left-overs" from the Columbia House Collections.I bought the seven disc set:Carol Burnett: Carol's Favorites Limited Edition (7 DVD Collection)because the 7 disc set has an extra 2 programs.You CAN get a six disc set :The Carol Burnett Show: Carol's Favorites (Collectors Edition).Double click to see what these cost today. I bought the 7-DVD set when it was $3 more than the 6-DVD set.I'll admit, right here, right now, I do NOT buy these for the songs/singers; I buy them for the SKITS!Comedy. Ah yes! Tim was a god in the 'sixties and 'seventies.Now that Carol is headed toward 80; Vicki is MY age(63); Tim has outlived Harvey; and, many other that were onthe show are gone to their heavenly rewards, I can still laugh my head off at Tim "THE DENTIST" and the manyother gags he did on the show.Get this one and the seven disc set, or just spring for the MEGA SET!Carol Burnett Show: The Ultimate Collection - 50 Episodes on 22 DVDs <======$400 here , but the same $400will get you the same set ===> Autographed by Carol; Tim; AND Vicki, at either TIME/LIFE or READERS DIGESTWebsites.The 22 discs, unsigned, cost $200... t-h-e-r-e.THERE!THAT is the most helpful review I can give you.From MY wallet to yours.Merry Christmas!
summary: Many options on THE CAROL BURNETT SHOW
Title: Carol Burnett Show: This Time Together

reviewText: It's ok but wanted more of the skits and not so much music.it was fun watching the old shows again.
Title: Carol Burnett Show: This Time Together

reviewText: Overall I was pleased with the DVD; it really shows the talent of Carol Burnett and the rest of the cast of the show.
Title: Carol Burnett Show: This Time Together

reviewText: If you bought Carol's Favorites there's no need to buy this collection bc there's only a few different episodes. When I saw another box of these I bought it up immediately thinking the whole thing would be different... I ended up returning it. Carol's great but this is an unnecessary release if you bought the 1st collection.GIVE US ANOTHER WHOLE BOX OF FRESH EPISODES OR DON'T BOTHER PUTTING ANY MORE OUT! BUYER BEWARE!
summary: BE CAREFUL! GIVE US ALL NEW EPISODES!
Title: Carol Burnett Show: This Time Together

reviewText: In 2012, Time Life went into their vault and rereleased The Carol Burnett Show on DVD in a Complete Collection of 22 discs and a hefty price tag!  For more limited budgets, they also released smaller compilations entitled "Carol's Favorites" in 6 disc, 2 disc, and one disc sets.  Well, I guess those must have been successful and profitable (I picked up the six disc set) for now we're being treated to another sampling from the larger collection.  "This Time Together" is likewise getting two versions: a six disc and a one disc selection.  I seriously doubt I need to sell anyone on the idea that The Carol Burnett Show was brilliant television. Just thought I'd let you know the content of the different sets.Six Disc Set:If you are familiar with the 22 disc Complete Collection, this offering gives you Discs 8, 10, 11, 12, 13, and 14.  The guest stars within the contained episodes include Dick Van Dyke, The Pointer Sisters, Hal Linden, Steve Lawrence, Eydie Gorme, Madeline Kahn, Peggy Lee, Stiller & Meara, Ken Berry, Petula Clark, Sammy Davis Jr., Roddy McDowall, Bernadette Peters, and Lily Tomlin.Some of the sketches included, a good cross section:The FamilyMrs WigginsThe Oldest ManThe CharwomanAs The Stomach TurnsBonus Features:This Time Together: Cast reunion with Carol, Vicki Lawrence, Tim Conway and Lyle WaggonerInterviews with Tim Conway, Steve Lawrence, Carol Burnett and Vicki LawrenceFeaturette: Gags and Gowns - A Tribute to Designer Bob MackieOne Disc Set:This is the three shows from Disc 10 of the Complete Collection that feature Dick Van Dyke, Roddy McDowall, Bernadette Peters, and Sammy Davis Jr.Bonus Features:Sunnyset Boulevard: The great parody of Sunset BoulevardFocus on The Family FeaturetteBring Up the Lights: Carol's Q&As; FeaturetteAs someone who did not invest in the Complete Collection, I really appreciate these more affordable options.  I hope they keep coming and that, eventually, it will make up the entire series.  The releases so far have been a bit confusing, though.  With all the episodes mixed up on all the discs, it becomes exceedingly difficult to realize what you've got and what you don't.  I'm a bit of a completist.  I like things more linear I suppose, so I wanted to spell out what these new releases consisted of.  KGHarris, 12/12.
summary: More Classic Carol: A New 6 Disc Or 1 Disc Option Provides New Episodes If You Haven't Bought The Complete Collection
Title: Carol Burnett Show: This Time Together

reviewText: it was really funny. I really like Carol Burnett show. Thank you very much for the product shown here. :)
Title: Carol Burnett Show: This Time Together

reviewText: Carol has always been one of my favorite comedians and while this dvd has some funny skits, some of the skits aren't as funny as I had hoped.
Title: Carol Burnett Show: This Time Together

reviewText: Always loved this show. Watched it with my two children at their grandparents, my parents, house. Brings back many good memories. I admire Carol very much in her real life as well as her professional life.
Title: Carol Burnett Show: This Time Together

Title: Carol Burnett Show: This Time Together

reviewText: I was looking for a collection of my favorite skits. Instead, I got a large collection of Tarzen yells (one or two would have plenty.) Also in the collection were many musical numbers, most very old and a bit grainy. So, dissapointment  abounded when I viewed this set. Wonder which set they hid the really good stuff in?
Title: Carol Burnett Show: This Time Together

reviewText: This is an awesome DVD. It is definitely a collectors edition. I remember Carol Burnett as a kid. She was hilarious. She still is. I love the old shows. Ones like this you can't watch on t.v. anymore. I have sat back and watched this a few times. I get great laughs every time I sit down and watch. It was money well spent. I would say if you love the old shows purchase this. You will remember the good old days.
Title: Carol Burnett Show: This Time Together

reviewText: "Carol Burnett: This Time Together" is a six-DVD set containing 17 complete episodes of "The Carol Burnett Show," an entertainment staple on CBS for 11 years, from 1967 to 1978.  Burnett and her cast -- Harvey Korman, Tim Conway, Vicki Lawrence, Lyle Waggoner -- kept TV audiences in stitches with their parodies of motion pictures, original skits and characters, and guest star appearances.Featured in this set are Sammy Davis, Jr., Dick Van Dyke, Steve Lawrence, Eydie Gorme, Madeline Kahn, Peggy Lee, Petula Clark, Bernadette Peters, Roddy McDowall, and Lily Tomlin.  Classic sketches include "The Family" (later "Mama's Family"), "Mrs. Wiggins," "As the Stomach Turns," "The Ham Actor," and "The Oldest Man."  Parodies include "TV Commercials," "No Frills Airline," "The Recital," and a wonderful spoof in which Burnett as Esther Williams attends contract negotiations in her trademark bathing suit and sloshing sounds are heard every time she takes a step.The nearly two hours of bonus features include "This Time Together," a cast reunion with Burnett, Lawrence, Tim Conway, and Lyle Wggoner; a tribute to costume designer Bob Mackie; and interviews with Burnett, Conway, and Vicki Lawrence.
summary: A delightful visit to classic TV comedy moments
Title: Carol Burnett Show: This Time Together
